s.text: The Safeway that supplied the beers didn't carry any true bargain-basement products, such as "Red, White, and Blue," "Old German," or the one with generic printing that just says "Beer."

Here again one costly beer-- Sam Adams --shows up well, while another, Grolsch , continues to struggle, but not as badly as the medium-price Miller Genuine Draft . Sam's success could reflect its quasi-mislabeling, presenting a strong-flavored beer as a "lager."

Here again one costly beer-- Sam Adams --shows up well, while another, Grolsch , continues to struggle, but not as badly as the medium-price Miller Genuine Draft . Sam's success could reflect its quasi-mislabeling, presenting a strong-flavored beer as a "lager."
In a familiar pattern, we have Grolsch bringing up the rear, with less than one-quarter the Taste-o-meter power of Busch , the No.
In a familiar pattern, we have Grolsch bringing up the rear, with less than one-quarter the Taste-o-meter power of Busch , the No.
I love beer, but lately I've been wondering: Am I getting full value for my beer dollar?
The taster who took the longest, nearly the full two hours, had the ratings that came closest to the relative price of the beers.
In a familiar pattern, we have Grolsch bringing up the rear, with less than one-quarter the Taste-o-meter power of Busch , the No.
But on the basis of evidence to date, we can say:
Has dark orangey-amber color that was obviously different from all other lagers tested.
Has dark orangey-amber color that was obviously different from all other lagers tested.
The experimenters were asked not to compare impressions until the test was over.
